III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth voices their concerns and believes they are being punished
in retaliation.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone in conjunction with
MDHHS Worker. Complainant reported she feels like “punished”
is too strong of a word to describe what Youth A informed them.
Youth A stated he feels he gets in trouble more than the other
youth. Complainant stated Youth A told her he got in trouble and
an unknown staff shouted at him and said, “fuck you”.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/27/24
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he feels
Staff 2 bullies him by making problems for no reason, such as
giving him a hard time when he asks for something. Youth A could
not provide any specific examples for what Staff 2 says or does to
give him a hard time. Youth A reported no staff have ever sworn at
him or punished him for complaining. Youth A reported if he has a
complaint, he talks to Supervisor or another staff about it.
Educational Specialist (ES) was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 3/27/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. ES
reported she has a good relationship with Youth A, and he has
talked to her about other staff if they’re upsetting him. ES reported
he has never complained he is being punished by any staff, fears
staff, is concerned of retaliation, or any staff have sworn at him.
ES reported she has never heard any staff having these types of
interactions with Youth A.
Case Manager (CM) was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 3/27/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. CM reported
Youth A has never complained to her about staff cussing at him or
punishing him out of retaliation. CM reported she has never heard
any staff having these types of interactions with Youth A. CM
2

reported if Youth A has any concerns or issues with staff, he has
been very vocal about them.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/15/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A has never
complained about staff cussing at him or punishing him, and he’s
never seen either occur.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/27/24
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A
only likes staff if they do what he wants them to do, when he
wants them to do it. Staff 2 reported when staff, like her, abide by
the rules, Youth A cusses at them and gets angry at them. Staff 2
reported Youth A has never complained staff have cussed at him
or punished him, and she has never seen either happen.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/27/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported Youth A is very vocal with complaints if he has them.
Supervisor reported she has never seen or heard staff cussing at
Youth A and Youth A has never complained about it either.
Supervisor reported Youth A frequently cusses at staff, which can
become very hostile on his part. Supervisor reported Youth A has
never complained staff are punishing him out of retaliation, and
she has not seen this occur.
Therapist 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/17/24 and
Therapist 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/18/24 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Therapist 1 and Therapist 2
reported Youth A has never complained staff have cussed at him
or punished him in retaliation.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Staff Conduct and Expectations Policy states staff are
expected to be professional, honest, responsible, and
positive role models. Staff are to maintain calm demeanor
and refrain from yelling or using profanity towards youth.
Staff are to follow the rules of the unit.
• Emergency Physical Restraint Policy and Procedures
states denial of any essential program service (i.e. food,
family time, communication with family, opportunity for 8
hours of sleep, shelter, clothing, medical care, essential
personal needs, culturally specific items, or any actions that
inhibit a youth’s ability to achieve permanency) as
punishment is not allowed.
3

• Grievance Policy outlines the steps of the grievance
process when a youth has a complaint about the program,
staff decisions or actions, agency policy, or in any
circumstance where the youth feels his/her rights have
been violated.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as based on staff interviews
and Youth A’s interview they all deny any staff were punishing
Youth A in retaliation or cussed at him.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
